===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
In current form {{Han compound|曲|辰|t2=field|ls=ic}}. Top unrelated to {{lang|zh|曲}}, and previously two hands, one on either side of a bundle {{zh-l|*田}} – a farmer bringing goods to market, from the field {{zh-l|*辰}}.

===Etymology===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|のう}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=のう}} {{m|zh|農|tr=nowng|agriculture, farming}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|のう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|のう}}

# [[agriculture]], [[farming]]
# a [[farmer]]

====Usage notes====
For the {{m|en|farmer}} sense, the terms {{m|ja|農家|tr=nōka}} or {{m|ja|農夫|tr=nōfu||male farmer}} or {{m|ja|農婦|tr=nōfu||female farmer}} may be used more often.

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|農園|のうえん}}: a [[plantation]] {{qualifier|emphasis on the growing of garden products}}
* {{ja-r|農家|のうか}}: a [[farmer]]; a [[farming]] [[family]]
* {{ja-r|農業|のうぎょう}}: [[farming]] {{qualifier|as an [[occupation]]}}
* {{ja-r|農作|のうさく}}: [[farming]] {{qualifier|with an emphasis on the work itself}}
* {{ja-r|農商|のうしょう}}: [[agriculture]] and [[commerce]]
* {{ja-r|農場|のうじょう}}: a [[farm]] {{qualifier|including the buildings}}
* {{ja-r|農地|のうち}}: [[agricultural]] [[land]], a [[farm]] {{qualifier|emphasis on the land}}
* {{ja-r|農民|のうみん}}: a [[peasant]], an [[agrarian]]
